Turn number: 0, Roll: 2. Where will you move your token?

MY MOVE: X -> 0 ; Y -> 0

Explanation:

At the beginning of the game, neither of my tokens (X or Y) are on the board. I cannot move any tokens since I don't have any tokens on the board. You have rolled a 2, but I cannot utilize this roll since I don't have any tokens on the board to move. So, I have to skip this turn.

Also, I will keep track of the state of the board and the positions of my tokens as follows:

Current state with my tokens: □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ X Y (off the board, but I'm keeping track of their positions)

So, my token X is at position 0 and my token Y is at position 0 as well.

Player 2 Answered:
MY MOVE: A -> 1 ; B -> 0

Current state: A □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □
Turn number: 1, Roll: 6. Where will you move your token?

MY MOVE: X -> 1 ; Y -> 0

Explanation:

In this turn, you have rolled a 6, which allows me to add a token to the board. I will add my token X to the board at position 1. My other token Y remains off the board at position 0. I choose to move token X because it is the token I just added to the board, and I want to start moving towards the right side of the board.

Current state with my tokens: A X □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □

My token X is at position 1, and my token Y is at position 0 (off the board).

Player 2 Answered:

MY MOVE: X -> 4 ; Y -> 0

Explanation:

In this turn, I will move my token X from position 1 to position 4, as you have rolled a 4. I cannot move my token Y since it is still off the board.

Current state with my tokens: □ X □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □ □

My token X is at position 4, and my token Y is at position 0 (off the board).
